item.title: Curiculum Vitae
item.description: Having completed my engineering degree in applied mathematics at Polytech Sorbonne, I am now specializing in Statistics at Sorbonne University in order to move towards an academic thesis…

item.title: Comparison between trees estimators and the DiaRem score for diabete remission classification
item.description: The goal of the TME is to develop practical skills to use decision trees and random forest for real biological applications.

item.title: Language model for music generation
item.description: The objective of this project is to determine a set of statistical methods for generating musical sequences. Because of the proximity of language and music, the majority of the methods used are borrowed from Natural Language Processing.

item.title: About
item.description: Recently graduated in applied mathematics and computer science at Polytech Sorbonne, I am currently specializing in statistics at Sorbonne University in order to orient myself towards an academic career. I am currently looking for a research internship (April - October) in the field of causal inference or inverse problem solving which would allow me to pursue an academic thesis.

Recently graduated in Applied Mathematics and Computer Science at Polytech Sorbonne, I am now specialising in Statistics at Sorbonne University. I am also looking for a research internship in the field of causal inference or inverse problem solving that could lead me to an academic thesis. See more about me.

item.title: Causal Inference
item.description: Reading The Book of Why: The New Science of Cause and Effect (J.Pearl, 2018) recently introduced me to an absolutely fascinating field of research. At the junction of statistics and theoretical computer science, it interests me both in the questions it raises in our relationship to science and in the various applications it allows. So I am currently supplementing my knowledge on this subject by reading the books Causality (J.Pearl, 2000) and Causal inference in statistics : a primer (Pearl, Glymou & Jewell, 2016) and also with the Jonas Peters' lectures on causality.

item.title: Earth System Science
item.description: I was introduced to climate science and the study of the Earth system as a whole in a course given by Hervé Le Treut during my preparatory classes. Since then, I have been interested in scientific issues related to earth system modelling, which is why I did my final year internship at the Locéan laboratory on the issues of tuning coupled ocean-atmosphere models using machine learning and Bayesian optimisation methods (History Matching). You may read my report for more information about the work I did there.

item.title: Health Data Science
item.description: The application of machine learning methods to health sciences was introduced during a project on machine learning for medical imagerie at Polytech Sorbonne supervised by Xavier Tannier. Afterwards, the problems related to the management of covid made me wonder about the responsibility of scientists and more particularly of statisticians on public health issues. Therefore, I am currently taking a course in Machine learning for medical data supervised by Nataliya Sokolovska in order to learn more about this subject.

item.title: Nonparametric inference
item.description: Having discovered non-parametric inference during a statistical learning project, I was able to develop my knowledge of this field of research in statistics and data science during an introductory course on non-parametric methods supervised by Charlotte Dion-Blanc and Ismael Castillo), for which I carried out a project on the estimation of density and survival function by kernel methods within the framework of the multiplicative censoring model.
